com.digi.xbee.api.packet.common

Class TransmitPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.digi.xbee.api.packet.XBeePacket
      • com.digi.xbee.api.packet.XBeeAPIPacket
        • com.digi.xbee.api.packet.common.TransmitPacket

  • public class TransmitPacket
extends XBeeAPIPacket
    This class represents a Transmit Packet. Packet is built using the parameters of the constructor or providing a valid API payload.

    A Transmit Request API frame causes the module to send data as an RF packet to the specified destination.

    The 64-bit destination address should be set to 0x000000000000FFFF for a broadcast transmission (to all devices).

    The coordinator can be addressed by either setting the 64-bit address to all 0x00 and the 16-bit address to 0xFFFE, OR by setting the 64-bit address to the coordinator's 64-bit address and the 16-bit address to 0x0000.

    For all other transmissions, setting the 16-bit address to the correct 16-bit address can help improve performance when transmitting to multiple destinations.

    If a 16-bit address is not known, this field should be set to 0xFFFE (unknown).

    The Transmit Status frame (APIFrameType.TRANSMIT_REQUEST) will indicate the discovered 16-bit address, if successful (see TransmitStatusPacket).

    The broadcast radius can be set from 0 up to NH. If set to 0, the value of NH specifies the broadcast radius (recommended). This parameter is only used for broadcast transmissions.

    The maximum number of payload bytes can be read with the NP command.

    Several transmit options can be set using the transmit options bitfield.

    See Also:
    XBeeTransmitOptions, XBee16BitAddress.COORDINATOR_ADDRESS, XBee16BitAddress.UNKNOWN_ADDRESS, XBee64BitAddress.BROADCAST_ADDRESS, XBee64BitAddress.COORDINATOR_ADDRESS, XBeeAPIPacket

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransmitPacket

        public TransmitPacket(int frameID,
                      XBee64BitAddress destAddress64,
                      XBee16BitAddress destAddress16,
                      int broadcastRadius,
                      int transmitOptions,
                      byte[] rfData)
        Class constructor. Instantiates a new TransmitPacket object with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        frameID - Frame ID.
        destAddress64 - 64-bit address of the destination device.
        destAddress16 - 16-bit address of the destination device.
        broadcastRadius - maximum number of hops a broadcast transmission can occur.
        transmitOptions - Bitfield of supported transmission options.
        rfData - RF Data that is sent to the destination device.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if frameID < 0 or if frameID > 255 or if broadcastRadius < 0 or if broadcastRadius > 255 or if transmitOptions < 0 or if transmitOptions > 255.
        NullPointerException - if destAddress64 == null or if destAddress16 == null.
        See Also:
        XBeeTransmitOptions, XBee16BitAddress, XBee64BitAddress

    • Method Detail

      • createPacket

        public static TransmitPacket createPacket(byte[] payload)
        Creates a new TransmitPacket object from the given payload.
        Parameters:
        payload - The API frame payload. It must start with the frame type corresponding to a Transmit packet (0x10). The byte array must be in OperatingMode.API mode.
        Returns:
        Parsed Transmit Request packet.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if payload[0] != APIFrameType.TRANSMIT_REQUEST.getValue() or if payload.length < or if frameID < 0 or if frameID > 255 or if broadcastRadius < 0 or if broadcastRadius > 255 or if transmitOptions < 0 or if transmitOptions > 255.
        NullPointerException - if payload == null.
